CARDINAL . Pursuant to Article ORG ) , courts can issue an interim measure when there is a need to regulate the parties’ situation in a temporary manner or where it is feared that the execution of a judicial decision could be jeopardised .

CARDINAL . Article GPE ) provides that a court shall issue an interim measure upon request . Such a request is not necessary where an interim measure concerns proceedings which courts can start of their own motion .
CARDINAL . Under LAW courts can start proceedings even in the absence of a request in matters concerning , inter alia , the care of minors .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE provides that a complaint to ORG must indicate , inter alia , the decision which the plaintiff seeks to obtain .
